title: Complaints Against Law Enforcement and Correctional Officers
subject: subject index

abstracts.abstract: Complaints Against Law Enforcement and Correctional Officers;  Requiring that a copy of a complaint, signed by the complainant under oath, be provided to law enforcement officers and correctional officers who are under investigation before any interrogation begins; providing that complainant names and signatures are not required if a complaint is accompanied by corroborating evidence; prohibiting certain personnel actions from being taken against a law enforcement officer or correctional officer unless such officer receives a copy of the complaint signed by the complainant under oath, etc.

actions.description: Referred to Criminal Justice; Governmental Oversight and Accountability; Rules
